p: Hempseeds have also been used by humans for a long time as a rich source of protein and oil. Hempseeds are one of the most nutritious seeds in the world containing 20–25% protein, 20–30% carbohydrate, 25–35% oil, and 10–15% insoluble fiber. These seeds also contain optimum amounts of phosphorus, potassium, magnesium, sulfur, calcium, iron, zinc, and a variety of vitamins A, C, and E as well as minerals, beta-carotene, and antioxidants [ 18]. The hempseed oil contains balanced ratios of optimum amounts of unsaturated chain fatty acids, including linoleic acid and linolenic acid, which are beneficial to human nutrition and health and reduce cholesterol levels and hypertension [ 19]. Additionally, due to the high amounts of PUFA and the presence of gamma-linoleic acid, the hempseed oil is used in the cream and lacquer manufacturing industries and in cosmetics such as moisturizers and shampoos, massages oils, conditioners, and lotions.
